entries.name: Age
entries: Aarakocra reach maturity by age 3. Compared to humans, aarakocra don't usually live longer than 30 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most aarakocra are good and rarely choose sides when it comes to law and chaos. Tribal leaders and warriors might be lawful, while explorers and adventurers might tend toward chaotic.

entries.name: Size
entries: Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 50 feet. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Talons
entries: Your talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the talons in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Bird of Prey
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Aarakocra|mm}, and {@language Primordial|phb|Auran}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aasimar mature at the same rate as humans, but they can live up to 160 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Aasimar have the same range of height and weight as humans.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Blessed with a radiant soul, your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Celestial Revelation
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Light Bearer
entries: You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an Celestial.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Celestial|phb}.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Construct.

entries.name: Age
entries: Like gnomes, autognomes can live for centuries, typically up to 500 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Autognomes are typically Lawful Neutral, able to carry out the orders of their creator exceptionally well as they were built from the minds of geniuses.

entries.name: Size
entries: Autognomes bear a resemblance to its creator, sharing their height, but often being many times their creator's weight. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Armored Casing
entries: You are encased in thin metal or some other durable material. While you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Mechanical Nature
entries: You are constructed to fulfill a purpose, and as such have special properties related to being a construct:

items: You are immune to Poison damage
You are immune to being Asleep, Diseased, {@condition Exhaustion|thicc|Exhausted}, and {@condition Poisoned|phb}.
You don't have to and cannot eat or drink, meaning you can't gain the benefits of potions or food.
You can not breathe, and are immune to breathing-related checks such as smelling or poison gas.
Any missing limbs can be reattached via the {@spell Mending|cooms} or {@spell Repair|cooms} spells following the rules and stipulations of the given spells.
You may not expend hit dice to heal on a short rest

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you remain conscious.

entries.name: One of a Kind
entries: When you die, the magic used in your creation is released into the world, just as it would with any other broken magic item. If your body is somehow reanimated, you will not be the same person, acting as a new character, only retaining the things that are inherent to your old body such as any modifications you made to it.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Gnomish|phb}

entries.name: Age
entries: Axani mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Axani are planetouched by the Lawful planes, and they tend to stick to Lawful Neutral. There are about equal portions of Axani as Lawful Evil and Good. Neutral Axani are extremely rare, and Chaotic Axani are almost unheard of.

entries.name: Appearence
entries: Axani typically have overly neat, orderly appearances; often favoring simple but elegant clothing and hairstyles. Their faces can be seen as traditionally attractive, with symmetrical, well-placed and portioned features, with no body or facial hair. Rarely, an Axani might have a metallic tint to their skin or hair.

entries.name: Size
entries: Axani are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Scrupulous
entries: Axani have an intense eye for detail, able to pick out flaws in anything if given the opportunity. They are also very thorough in arguments, leaving no room for misinterpretation. You gain proficiency in either {@skill Investigation|phb} or {@skill Persuasion|phb}.

entries.name: Lawful Resistance
entries: You have resistance to either Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage.

entries.name: Establish Order
entries: You know the {@spell mending|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell command|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell calm emotions|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Modron|mm}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Bugbears reach adulthood at age 16 and live up to 80 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Bugbears live on the fringes of society, where they value self-sufficiency and violence. They are generally chaotic, organizing in loose tribes under charismatic and powerful leaders.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most bugbears are between 6 and 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sneaky
entries: You have expertise in the {@skill Stealth|phb} skill alongside proficiency in either the {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb} skill.

entries.name: Long-Limbed
entries: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Goblin|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Bullywugs, once hatched, are considered to be a tadpole-like spawn until they are able to sprout legs at about six to eight weeks. Bullywugs were considered juvenile at this stage until age 6, and they live to be about 50 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Bullywugs live in a savage and tribal society where you have to be strong to survive the harsh swamps, leading most towards Evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Bullywugs range in size from 4 to 7 feet tall, and are anywhere from 100 to 300 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 40 feet.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Arboreal Alertness
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|phb} skill.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: You can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when you speak in Bullywug.

entries.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|phb}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries: If you fail to immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour during a day, you suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion|thicc} at the end of that day. You can only recover from this {@condition exhaustion|thicc} through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Bullywug|mm}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Cansin mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Cansin are planetouched by the Chaotic planes, tending towards Chaotic alignments; but their excessive unpredictability makes neutral and even lawful Cansin more common than good Tieflings, evil Aasimar, and especially chaotic Axani.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Cansin generally appear disheveled and disorganized, with mismatched clothing, messy hair, and any accessories worn in strange ways or unnatural angles. Cansin typically manifest their heritage through their eyes randomly changing color (not necessarily in sync), slightly irregular features, or even an aura of randomness that causes strange occurrances near them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cansin are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Spontaneous Creativity
entries: Cansin are notoriously excellent bullshitters, able to spin a story off of nothing by picking up random details about the world around them. You gain proficiency in either {@skill Deception|phb} or {@skill Perception|phb}.

entries.name: Chaotic Resistance
entries: Whenever you complete a long rest, roll a {@dice d6}. Depending on the result, you gain one or more resistances to damage types as described in the Chaotic Resistances table below:

entries.caption: Chaotic Resistances
rows: Roll of this table twice, gaining resistance to all damage types rolled, ignoring any duplicates.

entries.name: Wild Innate Spellcasting
entries: Each time you finish a long rest, you gain the ability to cast cantrips and spells randomly determined by rolling a {@dice d20} on the Wild Innate Spellcasting table below. Starting at 1st level, you get a new cantrip every long rest, which replaces the old one you gained from this feature. If you already know the cantrip that you roll, you may choose to reroll a new cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can roll to gain a 1st level spell with this trait from the table below, being able to cast it once per short or long rest for free without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also roll to gain a 2nd level spell with this trait from the table below, being able to cast it once per long rest for free without requiring a material component. When you roll for any of those spell levels, you replace the spell you gained from this feature the day prior with the new one rolled. If you roll the same spell or cantrip you gained at the end of your previous long rest, roll again until you get a different result. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an aberration.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Slaad|mm}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Centaurs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Centaurs are inclined toward neutrality. Lagonna centaurs tend to be more lawful, while Pheres centaurs are more often chaotic.

entries.name: Size
entries: Centaurs stand between 6 and 7 feet tall, with their equine bodies reaching about 4 feet at the withers. Pheres centaurs tend to be slightly larger than Lagonna centaurs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: Your creature type is monstrosity, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Charge
entries: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

entries.name: Hooves
entries: Your hooves are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Equine Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

entries.name: Survivor
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Medicine|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Sylvan|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Cervans reach maturity around 12 years. They live long lives, between 100 and 150 years, something they attribute as the blessing of Eldath for their vegan way of life.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Cervans live long lives of peace in the forests they protect. Their first strategy is to befriend any nearby settlements, and normally stay near water, which they keep pure. They tend to enrich the land they settle on as much as it enriches them, leading them towards the Lawful Good alignment.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespan-typically a century or less. While a changeling can transform to conceal their age, the effects of aging affect them similarly to humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Changelings tend toward pragmatic neutrality, and few changelings embrace evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

entries.name: Changeling Instincts
entries: You have proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Insight|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, or {@skill Persuasion|phb}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|thicc} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your {@quickref proficiency bonus|phb}. On a failed save, the creature takes damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry that is a number of {@dice 1d10} equal to 1 less than your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Resilience
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Talented Miner
entries: You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwelves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of maturity for their culture of origin. For elvish cultures, this is 100. For dwarvish cultures, this is 50. By some cruel twist of fate, these creatures have an average lifespan of about 1,000 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwelves are 5 to 6 feet tall and have chubby builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Abomination
entries: You are generally regarded as a monstrosity, though you are a humanoid. You are seen as an elf by dwarves and a dwarf by elves. You have more than likely encountered bigotry and discrimination from whatever society you grew up in, causing you to have to adapt in some way.
Choose an option from the following list:
{@b Abandoned.} You have retreated away from society altogether and become a shut-in. You may reduce your Charisma ability score by 2 to 5 points and redistribute those points as you see fit.

{@b Abused.} What doesn't kill you makes you stronger, and boy have you ever taken a beating while younger. It's a miracle you're still alive! Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level, though your Strength and Wisdom decrease by 1.

{@b Neglected.} Being shunned from your community, you were denied basic education and had to steal to survive, only furthering the bigotry towards your kind. Your movement speed increases to 35 feet, though your Intelligence ability score decreases by 2 and your Wisdom or Charisma (your choice) decreases by 1.

{@b Ridiculed.} You developed thick skin, and learned to shrug off what people say, though if pushed hard enough you will snap. You have a bonus to Wisdom saving throws equal to your proficiency bonus, though you have disadvantage on all saves regarding sanity.

entries.name: Dwarven Heritage
entries: Choose an option from the following list:

{@b Duergar.} When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Hill.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
{@b Mountain.} You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Elven Heritage
entries: Choose an option from the following list:

{@b Drow.} You know the {@spell dancing lights|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|cooms} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

{@b Eladrin (Spring).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

{@b Eladrin (Summer).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:
Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

{@b Eladrin (Autumn).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

{@b Eladrin (Winter).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.
{@b High.} You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

{@b Pallid.} You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Sea.} You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.
{@b Shadar-kai.} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.
{@b Wood.} You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Societal Feature
entries: Choose an option from the following list:

{@b Dwarven.} You gain {@i Stonecunning}. You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}. You also either gain the {@i Talented Miner} feature or you gain proficiency in either {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Elven.} You learn Sylvan and one additional language of your choice. You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item tanto|OWL}, {@item wakizashi|OWL}, {@item katana|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|phb}.
{@b Human.} You gain two skill proficiencies and one additional language of your choice.

{@b Sea.} You can speak, read, and write Aquan. Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed. You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.

{@b Underdark.} You gain {@i Superior Darkvision} and {@i Sunlight Sensitivity}. You have proficiency with {@item battleaxe|phb|battleaxes}, {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}, {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows}, {@item light hammer|phb|light hammers}, {@item longbow|phb|longbows}, {@item longsword|phb|longswords}, {@item rapier|phb|rapiers}, {@item shortbow|phb|shortbows}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, and {@item warhammer|phb|warhammers}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Elvish.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} skill.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Elvish|phb}. {@language Elvish|phb} is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

entries.name: Age
entries: Erlidi mature at the same rate as a human, but due to their mixed blood, are considered lucky to live half as long.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Erlidi often feel at home following orders, and are as loyal as any dog, leading them tend towards Lawful alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Erlidi vary wildly in size, shape, and appearance due to their bastardized forms, being anywhere between 2 to 7 feet tall. Your size is Small or Medium, depending on your height.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Deformity
entries: Your deformed canid form allows you certain specialities, giving you proficiency in two of the following skills: {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, {@skill Investigation|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, {@skill Performance|phb}, {@skill Persuasion|phb}, {@skill Stealth|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.
{@i Additionally, choose one of the deformities based on your canid form from the following list:}

{@b Anxious.} You get stressed easily, especially when there are loud noises or in social situations with strangers, leading you to act rashly. You may increase your Strength or Dexterity ability score by 1, but you have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition Frightened|phb}, including being {@condition Frenzied|thicc}, such as in the case of the spell {@spell Enemies Abound|xge}.

{@b Complaisant.} You love making people happy, and being told you are wanted or loved. There is nothing better to you than following someone's orders. You may increase your Intelligence or Charisma ability score by 1, but you have disadvantage on saving throws against being Charmed, including being controlled, such as in the case of the spells {@spell Suggestion|phb} and {@spell Puppet|cooms}.

{@b Misshapen.} Your body resembles that which would normally only be the result of generations of inbreeding. Though your form is terrible for your overall health, you may find it specializes elsewhere. You may reduce your Constitution ability score by 2 to 5 points and redistribute those points as you see fit.
{@b Shadow-Dregged.} You have the slightest remnants of your Shadar-blaidd heritage. You gain 60 feet of Darkvision, but you also gain Sunlight Sensitivity.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Fey.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Fairy Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|cooms} cantrip.

Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|cooms} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell with this trait. Once you cast {@spell faerie fire|cooms} or {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: As humanoids related to the fey, firbolg have long lifespans. A firbolg reaches adulthood around 30, and the oldest of them can live for 500 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Firbolg are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 240 and 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Firbolg Magic
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic|phb} and {@spell disguise self|phb} with this trait, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability for them. Once you cast either spell, you can't cast it again with this trait until you finish a short or long rest. When you use this version of {@spell disguise self|phb}, you can seem up to 3 feet shorter than normal, allowing you to more easily blend in with humans and elves.

entries.name: Hidden Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically turn {@condition invisible|phb} until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Elvish|phb}, and {@language Giant|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Independent and self-reliant, genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an elemental.

entries.name: Age
entries: Giff have an average lifespan of about 70 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Traditionally, Giff live to wage war with whoever pays them and fire off anything that will go boom, whether that be bombs, gonnes, or cannons. They typically prefer amassing these kinds of weapons and black powder over any kind of material wealth. They, however, only fight under a strict militaristic regiment, taking pleasure in following orders and often making up medals for themselves as they wage war. They are typically Lawful.

entries.name: Size
entries: Giff are between 8 and 9 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Demolitionist
entries: Giffs have an innate love for anything that goes boom, leading them to prefer weapons that favor this style of explosive fighting. You have proficiency with firearms. Additionally, when you throw an explosive such as a bomb, oil, or alchemist's fire, you are able to throw it up to its maximum range without imposing disadvantage on the roll.

entries.name: Headfirst Charge
entries: You can throw yourself into battle and use your large size to get an edge over your opponents by toppling them over. If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line that ends within 5 feet of a Large or smaller creature, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Strength DC (8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength modifier) or take {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and Giff. The Giff language is gruff and covers a wide range of both high and low sounds.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gith reach adulthood in their late teens and live for about a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gith are taller and leaner than humans, with most a slender 6 feet in height.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Gith|mm}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnolls reach adulthood by the age of 20 and live to around 80.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Gnolls are usually chaotic neutral or evil, though there are exceptions.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most gnolls are between 6 and 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hungry Jaws
entries: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Endless Hunger
entries: You can eat and drink as well as retain the benefits of 5 times more food and drink than an equivalent creature of your size, but must eat and drink 3 times more than the average person to not starve.
When under the effects of starvation, you are frenzied.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you may use a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make a bite attack.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Frightful Appearance
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill intimidation|phb} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language Gnoll|mm}, and {@language Abyssal|GGR}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnomes mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Gnomish|phb}. The Gnomish language, which uses the Dwarvish script, is renowned for its technical treatises and its catalogs of knowledge about the natural world.

entries.name: Age
entries: Goblins reach adulthood at age 8 and live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Goblins are typically neutral evil, as they care only for their own needs. A few goblins might tend toward good or neutrality, but only rarely.

entries.name: Size
entries: Goblins are between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh between 40 and 80 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Cowards
entries: You have expertise in {@skill Stealth|phb}, and prefer underhanded tactics, allowing you to additionally gain proficiency in either {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage|phb} or {@action Hide|phb} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Goblin|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Goliaths have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Goliaths are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|phb} skill.

entries.name: Stone's Endurance
entries: You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Giant|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Grippli reach adulthood at the age of 30, and can live to around 700 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Grippli are generally neutral creatures, often organized into small tight-knit animal hunting tribes led by a tribe mother and an elder male.

entries.name: Size
entries: Grippli stand between 2.5 and 5 feet tall and weigh between 23 to 60 lbs. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a climbing speed and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Tongue
entries: Your tongue is a natural finesse weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal no damage and grapple the target, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. While {@condition grappled|phb} in this way, the target is {@condition restrained|phb}, and you can't attack another target with your tongue.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 20 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 30 feet and your high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and Grippli.

entries.name: Age
entries: Grungs mature to adulthood in a single year, but have been known to live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most grungs are lawful, having been raised in a strict caste system. They tend toward evil as well, coming from a culture where social advancement occurs rarely, and most often because another member of your army has died and there is no one else of that caste to fill the vacancy.

entries.name: Size
entries: Grungs stand between 2.5 and 3.5 feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Arboreal Alertness
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} skill.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Poison Immunity
entries: You're immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: Any creature that grapples you or otherwise comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Constitution DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become {@condition poisoned|phb} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned|phb} creature no longer in direct contact with you can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can also apply this poison to any piercing weapon as part of an attack with that weapon, though when you hit the poison reacts differently. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Constitution DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or take a number of {@dice d4} poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries: If you fail to immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour during a day, you suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion|phb} at the end of that day. You can only recover from this {@condition exhaustion|phb} through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Grung|VGM}.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Dexterous Feet
entries: As a bonus action, you can use your feet to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object.

entries.name: Glide
entries: When you fall at least 10 feet above the ground, you can use your reaction to extend your skin membranes to glide horizontally a number of feet equal to your walking speed, and you take 0 damage from the fall. You determine the direction of the glide.

entries.name: Hadozee Dodge
entries: The magic that runs in your veins heightens your natural defenses. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d6}. Add your proficiency bonus to the number rolled, and reduce the damage you take by an amount equal to that total (minimum of 0 damage).
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Halfbloods mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halfbloods are 4.5-5.5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Bugbears mature at 17 years of age and can live to be about 90 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Bugbears are between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh between 200 and 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sneaky
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Powerful Build.} You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
{@b Long-Limbed.} When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Goblin|phb}.

items.name: Variant Feature; Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

items.name: Variant Feature; Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

items.name: Variant Feature; Long-Limbed
entries: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Dragons mature at the same rate as their non-dragon parent, but can live to the length of their draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Half-Dragons come in many forms, residing in a spectrum between their two parents. They can look more like a traditional member of the species of their non-dragon parent but with skin tinted to the color of their parent. They can also have the appearance of a draconic humanoid with scales that are the color of their dragon parent. They can also be an odd mix of the two; whatever fate happens to bring.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the creature takes damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry that is a number of {@dice 1d10} equal to 1 less than your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a dragon.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-elves mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live much longer than humans, however, often exceeding 180 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-elves are about the same size as humans, ranging from 5 to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Elvish|phb}. {@language Elvish|phb} is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Goblins mature at 10 years of age and can live to be about 80 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Goblins are between 3.5  and 4.5 feet tall and weigh between 60 and 100 pounds. Your size is Small. The only noticeable difference between half-goblins and goblins is their ears are short, but still pointed, and their eye colors are human colors.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Cowards
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Stealth|phb}, and prefer underhanded tactics, allowing you to additionally gain proficiency in either {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage|phb} or {@action Hide|phb} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Goblin|phb}.

items.name: Variant Feature; Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

items.name: Variant Feature; Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Variant Feature; Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage|phb} or {@action Hide|phb} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Harengon age and mature at the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Harengon are 4-6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Naturally Cute
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Perception}.

entries.name: Innocent Look
entries: When you fail a {@skill Deception}, {@skill Persuasion}, or {@skill Performance} check, you may use this feature to reroll the {@dice d20}, potentially resulting in a success. You may use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Hare-Trigger
entries: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

{@b Lucky Footwork.} When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. You can't use this reaction if you're {@condition prone|phb} or your speed is 0.

{@b Rabbit Hop.} As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 10 feet), without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Hobgoblins mature at the same rate as humans and have lifespans similar in length to theirs.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Hobgoblins are between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh between 100 and 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Strategists
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill History} skill.

entries.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, you can deal extra damage to a creature that you hit with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of yourself that isn't incapacitated. The extra damage is a number of d6s equal to their proficiency bonus. You may use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Martial Training.} You are proficient with two {@filter Martial Weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} of your choice and with light armor.

{@b Saving Face.} Hobgoblins are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-ogres had the lifespan and maturity rate of their non-ogre parent.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Half-ogres tend towards Chaotic alignments, often believing they should be in charge for their strength and begrudgingly submitting to anybody stronger than them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-ogres have a height somewhere between that of a human and an ogre, often between seven and eight feet. They usually weigh between 315 and 425 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Giant Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

items: {@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

{@b Might Makes Right.} Whenever you make a {@skill Persuasion|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, or {@skill Intimidation|phb} skill check, you can give yourself a bonus to the check equal to your Strength modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a {@filter Giant|bestiary|type=giant}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Giant|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-orcs mature a little faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14. They age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 75 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: They are torn between the rage that naturally flows through their veins and the humanity within them. Raised in orc culture, they tend towards chaos and evil. Raised in human culture, they tend towards lawful neutral, or even sometimes good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-orcs are somewhat larger and bulkier than humans, and they range from 5 to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Relentless Endurance.} When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
{@b Aggressive.} As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.
{@b Powerful Build.} You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc. Orc is a harsh, grating language with hard consonants. It has no script of its own but is written in the Dwarvish script.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Tabaxi age and mature at the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Tabaxi are 5-7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Top Cat
entries: Your natural popularity mixes well with your feline instincts. You gain proficiency in three of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Stealth}.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

{@b Feline Agility.} Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

{@b Cat's Claws.} Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-trolls had the lifespan and maturity rate of their non-troll parent.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Half-trolls tend towards Evil alignments, typically being in their element when working as an unsupervised mercenary or hired goon.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-trolls have a height somewhere between that of a human and a troll, often between 6.5 to 7.5 feet tall. They usually weigh between 255 and 365 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

items: {@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Trollhide.} While you aren't wearing armor, your rubbery skin gives you a base Armor Class of 10 plus your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a {@filter Giant|bestiary|type=giant}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Giant|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened|phb}.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Halfling|phb}. The Halfling language isn't secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don't have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

entries.name: Age
entries: Harengon age and mature at the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Harengon are 4-6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Hare-Trigger
entries: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls.

entries.name: Leporine Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} skill.

entries.name: Lucky Footwork
entries: When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. You can't use this reaction if you're {@condition prone|phb} or your speed is 0.

entries.name: Rabbit Hop
entries: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 10 feet), without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed is greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Hedges take longer to mature than most other races, reaching adulthood around 20 years. They also live for a long time, with many reaching 120 years or more.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Hunker hedges tend to live slow, cozy lives, often aligning themselves with Law. Roller hedges are the exact opposite, living lives that are as bombastic and as fast as they are, often aligning themselves with chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Hedges have short, rounded body shapes, standing between 3 and 4 feet in height, and weighing between 40 and 70 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Spiny Quills
entries: The backs of hedges are covered with spiny quills, which makes it difficult for hedges to wear armor. These quills provide some protection, giving you a natural armor of 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

Due to your quills, it takes twice as long for you to don and doff armor. On top of this, anybody who hits you with an unarmed strike takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage if you are either unarmored or wearing spiked leather, spiked armor, or spike mail.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Hobgoblins mature at the same rate as humans and have lifespans similar in length to theirs.

entries.name: Size
entries: Hobgoblins are between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh between 150 and 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Strategists
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill History} skill.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You are proficient with two {@filter Martial Weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} of your choice and with light armor.

entries.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, you can deal extra damage to a creature that you hit with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of yourself that isn't incapacitated. The extra damage is a number of d6s equal to their proficiency bonus. You may use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Saving Face
entries: Hobgoblins are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Goblin|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Ability Score Decrease
entries: Decrease an ability score by 2 or two unique ability scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: You mature at the same rate of a human and age similarly unless your curse interferes with this.

entries.name: Size
entries: You have a similar height and size of a human, that being 5 to 6 feet and Medium, unless your curse interferes with this.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills or tools of your choice.

entries.name: Curse
entries: For whatever reason, your being is inflicted with a curse. This could be the result of a devil's contract, some unholy circumstance surrounding your birth, or some other affliction. You and your DM can craft a curse together and make an origin, effects, and any potential benefits that the curse unintentionally brings. Because this curse is intertwined with your very being, much like naturally born lycanthropes, this curse can only be cured with the use of the {@spell Wish|phb} spell.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: You tend to age slower than a regular human, though you still mature at the same rate. Your life expectancy can easily exceed 2,000 years, or even double that depending on the color of your Dragon's Heart.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Human Versatility
entries: You may choose either an additional proficiency in a skill, tool, or the ability to speak an additional language.

entries.name: Draconic Ability
