entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Perception|phb}.

entries.name: Dragon's Heart
entries: You have the heart of a dragon at the core of your being, touched by the ancients that once dominated the prime material plane. This can be from heritage or from more nefarious means. Regardless, this manifests in many different ways, from differing hair and eye color to a series of intricate birthmarks that decorate your skin like a prideful tattoo.
You also gain damage resistance and a bonus proficiency based on the origin of your Dragon's Heart, as described below in the following table:

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Draconic|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: You tend to age slower than a regular human, though you still mature at the same rate. Your life expectancy can easily exceed 200 years, or even up to triple that depending on the Giant's Blood flowing through your veins.

entries.name: Size
entries: Giant's Blood humans tend to be taller and sometimes wider than regular humans. They range from 6.5 to 8 feet tall in adulthood.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Human Versatility
entries: You may choose either an additional proficiency in a tool or the ability to speak an additional language.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Titan's Body
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Athletics|phb}.

entries.name: Giant's Blood
entries: You have the blood of a giant flowing through your veins, touched by the primordials that once ruled the prime material plane. This can be from heritage or from more nefarious means. Regardless, this manifests in many different ways, from differing hair and eye color to a series of intricate birthmarks that decorate your skin like a prideful tattoo.

You also gain a bonus proficiency and a spell you can cast innately a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus using Constitution as your spellcasting modifier based on the origin of your Giant's Blood, as described below in the following table:

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Giant|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Jerbeens grow quickly, reaching maturity around 5 years and living to be about 40 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Being small and facing many threats in the world, Jerbeens are sensitive to the feelings of others, and tend towards good alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Jerbeens have incredibly small and light bodies, standing between 2 and 3 feet tall, and weighing between 20 and 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to hunting at night you have superior vision in the dark. You can see dim light within 60 feet of you as bright light and in darkness as if it was in dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Empathetic
entries: You tend to sneak and squeak your way into people's hearts, allowing you to commune with or understand others easily. You are proficient in two of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Insight|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, {@skill Performance|phb}, {@skill Persuasion|phb}, or {@skill Stealth|phb}.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Scamper
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Scurry
entries: When you take the dash action, your speed increases by 5 feet that turn, and your movement is not slowed by difficult terrain.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kalashtar mature and age at the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The noble spirit tied to a kalashtar drives it toward lawful and good behavior. Most kalashtar combine strong self-discipline with compassion for all beings, but some kalashtar resist the virtuous influence of their spirit.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Dual Mind
entries: You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Mental Discipline
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Mind Link
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

When you're using this trait to speak telepathically to a creature, you can use your action to give that creature the ability to speak telepathically with you for 1 hour or until you end this effect as an action. To use this ability, the creature must be able to see you and must be within this trait's range. You can give this ability to only one creature at a time; giving it to a creature takes it away from another creature who has it.

entries.name: Severed from Dreams
entries: Kalashtar sleep, but they don't connect to the plane of dreams as other creatures do. Instead, their minds draw from the memories of their otherworldly spirit while they sleep. As such, you are immune to spells and other magical effects that require you to dream, like {@spell dream|phb}, but not to spells and other magical effects that put you to sleep, like {@spell sleep|phb}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Quori|ERLW}, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Fearless
entries: You are immune to being {@condition Frightened|phb}.

entries.name: Kender Curiosity
entries: Thanks to the mystical origin of your people, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Insight|phb}, {@skill Investigation|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, {@skill Stealth|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Taunt
entries: You have an extraordinary ability to fluster creatures. As a bonus action, you can unleash a string of provoking words at a creature within 60 feet of yourself that can hear and understand you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Charisma DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier), or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kenku have shorter lifespans than humans. They reach maturity at about 12 years old and can live to 60.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kenku are around 5 feet tall and weigh between 90 and 120 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Expert Forgery
entries: You can duplicate other creatures' handwriting and craftwork. You have advantage on all checks made to produce forgeries or duplicates of existing objects.

entries.name: Kenku Training
entries: You are proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Stealth|phb}, and {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight|phb}) check opposed by your Charisma ({@skill Deception|phb}) check.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Primordial|phb|Auran}, but you can only speak using your Mimicry trait.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kitsunes have a similar lifespan to elves.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kitsune are between 4 to 5 feet tall and weigh around 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to hunting at night you have superior vision in the dark. You can see dim light within 60 feet of you as bright light and in darkness as if it was in dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Kitsune Shapeshift
entries: As an action, you can assume the appearance of a single specific human form of the same sex that always remains consistent with every use of this ability. In order for anyone to see your true nature, they have to succeed on an {@skill Investigation|phb} check against your {@skill Deception|phb} check, as you still need to hide your ears and tail. This change ends if you reach 0 hp or if you use an action to revert to your normal form.

entries.name: Tails
entries: You have a number of tails equal to the highest level spell you can cast (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Trickster Spirit
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, or {@skill Stealth|phb}.

entries.name: Kitsune Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Charm Person|phb} spell once with this trait; you gain the ability to cast it again when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Suggestion|phb} spell once with this trait; you gain the ability to cast it again when you finish a long rest. Constitution is the spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Claws
entries: You may sprout claws in your natural form or your humanoid form. Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fey.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Kitsunes can speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Sylvan|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kobolds reach adulthood at age 6 and can live up to 1,000 years but rarely do so. However, those lucky few metamorphosize into a dragon wyrmling based on their color, and begin a dragon's life cycle. This transformation is divine in nature, and normally is accomplished by gaining favor from Bahamut or Tiamat to be worthy of status as a dragon.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kobolds tend to be fairly disorganized by themselves, hence why they gravitate towards dragons as figures of authority and protection. This desire for strong leadership makes them tend towards lawful good, neutral, or evil depending upon the dragon they follow.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Because their patron deity has been trapped in a labyrinth for centuries, kobolds have deteriorated in consistent form, allowing them to come in many different shapes and designs; though their coloring is always based on a dragon's coloring, typically being the same as the one they follow.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kobolds are between 2 and 3 feet tall and weigh between 25 and 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Naturally Curious
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills: {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill History|phb}, {@skill Investigation|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, {@skill Religion|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, or {@skill Stealth|phb}.

entries.name: Talented Miner
entries: You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

entries.name: Makeshift Cunning
entries: Kobolds excel at making the most out of what limited resources they have, especially in the field of traps. Knowing they are outmatched in terms of power, most kobolds use their creativity to get the upper hand in combat. Unless forced, most kobolds prefer to flee towards a trap they've set to get an edge in a fight rather than fighting directly. By spending an hour gathering resources from your backpack and surroundings, you are able to make a rudimentary trap, tool, weapon, or piece of armor that only you are able to use, as others can't make sense of how it functions in the way you intend. For example, a kobold might jam a kitchen knife through a plank of wood to make a rudimentary war pick for themselves, or tie kitchenware to their body to simulate a breastplate. You can have a number of functional traps and items created with this feature equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). If you create something new with this feature while at capacity, your oldest created item or trap breaks.

entries.name: Grovel, Cower, and Beg
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a dragon.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Draconic|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Urds reach adulthood at age 6 and can live up to 1,000 years but rarely do so. However, those lucky few metamorphosize into a dragon wyrmling based on their color, and begin a dragon's life cycle. This transformation is divine in nature, and normally is accomplished by gaining favor from Bahamut or Tiamat to be worthy of status as a dragon.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Urds typically create their own societies governed by urd chieftains, and tend towards Lawful Evil. Urds born in a society of kobolds tend to align with their dragon.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Because their patron deity has been trapped in a labyrinth for centuries, kobolds have deteriorated in consistent form, allowing them to come in many different shapes and designs; though their coloring is always based on a dragon's coloring, typically being the same as the one they follow.

entries.name: Size
entries: Urds are between 2 and 3 feet tall and weigh between 30 and 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Thanks to your bat-like wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Naturally Curious
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Religion|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, or {@skill Stealth|phb}.

entries.name: Makeshift Cunning
entries: Kobolds excel at making the most out of what limited resources they have, especially in the field of traps. Knowing they are outmatched in terms of power, most kobolds use their creativity to get the upper hand in combat. Unless forced, most kobolds prefer to flee towards a trap they've set to get an edge in a fight rather than fighting directly. By spending an hour gathering resources from your backpack and surroundings, you are able to make a rudimentary trap, tool, weapon, or piece of armor that only you are able to use, as others can't make sense of how it functions in the way you intend. For example, a kobold might jam a kitchen knife through a plank of wood to make a rudimentary war pick for themselves, or tie kitchenware to their body to simulate a breastplate. You can have a number of functional traps and items created with this feature equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). If you create something new with this feature while at capacity, your oldest created item or trap breaks.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a dragon.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Draconic|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kuo-toa reach maturity at about age 5 and live to be around 60 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Kuo-toa typically live in a theocratic society, worshipping Blibdoolpoolp or some other god of their creation. As with many societies in the underdark, they kept slaves and thus tended towards Evil alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kuo-toa range in size from 4.5 to 5.5 feet tall, and on average weigh about 160 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Vigilant Believers
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} skill.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your body is covered in tough scales and slippery slime. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 11 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Slippery
entries: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

entries.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: You can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of yourself that is invisible or on the Ethereal Plane. You can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivty
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Undercommon|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Leonin mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Leonin tend toward good alignments. Leonin who are focused on the pride lean toward lawful good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Leonin are typically over 6 feet tall, with some standing over 7 feet. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Hunter's Instincts
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Daunting Roar
entries: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Leshies sprout from the ground after a year of being planted, and can walk around freely, but still need to plant themselves into the ground to sleep at night until they are 6 years of age, where they are considered to be ripe, their version of maturity. Leshies can live to be several hundred to a thousand years old depending on species.

entries.name: Size
entries: Native to forests in the feywild, leshies are little goobers, and they range from 2 to 4 feet tall. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Leshy Lore
entries: You deeply understand the natural world and your place within it. You have proficiency in Nature.

entries.name: Plant Nourishment
entries: You gain nourishment in the same way that the plants or fungi that match your body type normally do, through some combination of photosynthesis, absorbing minerals with your roots, or scavenging decaying matter. You typically do not need to pay for food. If you normally rely on photosynthesis and go without sunlight for 1 week, you begin to starve.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Plant.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and Terran.

entries.name: Age
entries: Lizardfolk reach maturity around age 14 and rarely live longer than 60 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Lizardfolk are a little bulkier and taller than humans, and their colorful frills make them appear even larger. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Cunning Artisan
entries: As part of a short rest, you can harvest bone and hide from a slain beast, construct, dragon, monstrosity, or plant creature of size small or larger to create one of the following items: a {@item shield|OWL}, a {@item club|OWL}, a {@item javelin|OWL}, or {@dice 1d4} {@item dart|OWL|darts} or {@item blowgun needle|OWL|blowgun needles}. To use this trait, you need a blade, such as a {@item dagger|OWL}, or appropriate {@filter artisan's tools|items|source=OWL|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools}, such as {@item leatherworker's tools|OWL}.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Hunter's Lore
entries: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, {@skill Stealth|phb}, and {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Hungry Jaws
entries: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Draconic|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Locathah mature to adulthood by the age of 10 but have been known to live up to 80 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most locathah are true neutral or have some aspect of neutrality in their alignment. They tend toward good, coming from a culture where compassion for the downtrodden is a commonality.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Observant & Athletic
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|phb} and {@skill Perception|phb} skills.

entries.name: Leviathan Will
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, {@condition frightened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, {@condition poisoned|phb}, {@condition stunned|phb}, or put to sleep.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: You can breathe air and water, but you need to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Size
entries: Locathah stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan} and {@language Common|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Loxodons physically mature at the same rate as humans, but they live about 450 years. They highly value the weight of wisdom and experience and are considered young until they reach the age of 60.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most loxodons are lawful, believing in the value of a peaceful, ordered life. They also tend toward good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Loxodons stand between 7 and 8 feet tall. Their massive bodies weigh between 300 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Loxodon Serenity
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition frightened|phb}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have thick, leathery skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Tip: AC Calculations Don't Stack
entries: When the game gives you more than one way to calculate your Armor Class, you can use only one of them. You choose the one to use. For example, if you have the loxodon's Natural Armor trait and the monk's Unarmored Defense feature, you don't mix them together. Instead, you choose which one determines your AC.

entries.name: Trunk
entries: You can grasp things with your trunk, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options.
Your trunk can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: Thanks to your sensitive trunk, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}), Wisdom ({@skill Survival|phb}), and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|phb}) checks that involve smell.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Loxodon|ggr}.

entries.name: Age
entries: M'jols are born with an unfortunate defect that only allows them half the lifespan of humans, even though they age at around the same rate. M'jols that make it past age 50 are considered to be extremely fortunate.

entries.name: Size
entries: M'jols are 7-8 feet tall and as wide as any dwarf. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Impotent
entries: Your unique heritage has left you with the unfortunate inability to breed or produce offspring. On top of this, any roll you make for virility is made at disadvantage.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Giant.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Giant.

entries.name: Age
entries: Mapachs mature quickly, reaching adulthood around 8 years. Despite this they have fairly average lifespans, the oldest among them living just past 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Mapachs love coveting whatever they can get their grubby little grabbies on, whether that be scrounging around for what others consider trash or plotting masterful heists to steal the most prized of possessions, tending towards Chaotic and Evil alignments. It is believed that Mapachs bear the symbol of Mask on their fur.

entries.name: Size
entries: Mapachs stand between 3.5 and 4.5 feet tall, and encompass a variety of builds from svelt to wide, weighing between 90 and 160 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Opportunists
entries: You are proficient in two of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Animal Handling|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Insight|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, {@skill Investigation|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, {@skill Stealth|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Expert Climbers
entries: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Resilient Immunity
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison and disease as well as resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Skulker
entries: You have advantage on Stealth checks made in dim light and darkness.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Merfolk matured at the same rate as humans, with a similar lifespan.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Merfolk tend towards neutrality, and are known to play pranks that may come across as cruel, but not overly malicious.

entries.name: Size
entries: Merfolk grew to be about 8 feet in length, and weighed about 400 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 10 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 40 feet.

entries.name: Underestimated
entries: Merfolk have more strength and wit than their gorgeous physique would imply. You gain proficiency in three of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics|phb}, {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, {@skill Insight|phb}, {@skill Persuasion|phb}, {@skill Performance|phb}, {@skill Stealth|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan}.
{@note These traits are also suitable for minotaurs in other D&D worlds where these people have avoided the demonic influence of Baphomet.}

entries.name: Age
entries: Minotaurs enter adulthood at around the age of 17 and can live up to 150 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most minotaurs who join the Boros Legion lean toward lawful alignments, while those associated with the Cult of Rakdos or the Gruul Clans tend toward chaotic alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Minotaurs average over 6 feet in height, and they have stocky builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Horns
entries: Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Goring Rush
entries: Immediately after you use the {@action Dash|phb} action on your turn and move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your horns as a bonus action.

entries.name: Hammering Horns
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the {@action Attack|phb} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to shove that target with your horns. The target must be no more than one size larger than you and within 5 feet of you. Unless it succeeds on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, you push it up to 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Imposing Presence
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Intimidation|phb} or {@skill Persuasion|phb}.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Minotaur|ggr}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Myconids reach maturity at 16 years old and can live to be a little over 1000 with the oldest ones becoming sovereigns. Their early life cycle consists of 6 stages every four years. At 24 years old they die unless they undergo a special regiment process to become a sovereign.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most myconids are True Neutral with good myconids are fairly common and evil myconids are very rare.

entries.name: Size
entries: Myconids range from 4 to 6 feet and weigh 70 to 120 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the darkness of the underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colors in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. If you have been in direct sunlight for a minute, you must make a DC 15 Con Save or take {@dice 1d4} radiant damage, with half as much on a successful save. You make this at the end of every minute you spend under the sun.

entries.name: Distress Spores
entries: When the myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries: As an action, you may extend rapport spores in a 20-foot radius. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead}, {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, or {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: As an action, you can eject spores at one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. You regain use of this trait once you have completed a short or long rest.

entries.name: Additional Spore Choice
entries: At 3rd level, you know one additional spore feature from the following list that you can use once per long rest:

items: {@b Animating Spores.} As an action, you can target one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet and release spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a {@creature Quaggoth Spore Servant|MM|spore servant} (MM p.231). The corpse stays animated for {@dice 1d4 + 1} days or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way. You can have a number of spore servants under your control at any given time equal to your proficiency bonus.

{@b Caustic Spores.} As an action, you release spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature inside the cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or take {@dice 1d6} acid damage at the start of their turns for up to 10 minutes. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on themselves as a success.

{@b Euphoria Spores.} As an action, you release a cloud of spores in a 20 ft. radius sphere centered on yourself. Other creatures in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or become {@condition poisoned} for up to 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature experiences a successive onslaught of raw pleasure. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on themselves as a success. When the effect ends on a creature, the creature gains 1 level of exhaustion.

{@b Hallucination Spores.} As an action, you release a trail of spores in a 30-foot line from yourself. Other creatures in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or become {@condition poisoned} for up to 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, they hallucinate. Each creature affected must flip a coin. On a heads, the creature experiences a good trip, and becomes stunned while it hallucinates. On a tails, the creature experiences a bad trip, and becomes frenzied, seeing threats everywhere while it hallucinates. While frenzied, the creature randomly attacks anything close to it, determined by the DM. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Poisonous Punch
entries: Anyone you hit with an unarmed attack must make a Constitution Saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or suffer an amount of poison damage equal to the die of your unarmed strike, taking no damage upon a success. For example, a regular mycanoid may only do {@dice 1d2} with this feature, but a mycanoid monk may do a {@dice d4}, {@dice d6}, etc.

entries.name: Plant Nourishment
entries: You gain nourishment in the same way that the {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant} or fungi that match your body type normally do, through some combination of photosynthesis, absorbing minerals with your roots, or scavenging decaying matter. You typically do not need to pay for food.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a {@filter Plant|bestiary|type=plant}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand, read and write {@language Common} and {@language Undercommon} but not speak them.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ogrillons reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ogrillon tend towards Chaotic and Non-Good alignments, much like both sides of their heritage.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ogrillon have a height somewhere between that of an orc and an ogre, often between 7 and 8 feet. They usually weigh between 315 and 425 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

items: {@b Giant Toughness.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
{@b Relentless Endurance.} When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
{@b Aggressive.} As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

{@b Might Makes Right.} Whenever you make a {@skill Persuasion|phb}, {@skill Deception|phb}, or {@skill Intimidation|phb} skill check, you can give yourself a bonus to the check equal to your Strength modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a {@filter Giant|bestiary|type=giant}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Giant|phb}, and {@language Orc|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Orcs reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Orcs tend strongly toward chaos and evil, but some, such as in the case of the Many-Arrows tribe, tend toward law.

entries.name: Size
entries: Orcs are usually over 6 feet tall and weigh between 230 and 280 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Primal Intuition
entries: You have proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, and {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Orc|phb}. {@language Orc|phb} is a harsh, grating language with hard consonants. It has no script of its own but is written in the Dwarvish script.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of yourself as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Thanks to your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Silent Feathers
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|phb} skill.

entries.name: Age
entries: Para-genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Independent and self-reliant, para-genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Para-genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an elemental.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an Ooze.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Natural Resilience
entries: You have resistance to acid and poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb}.

entries.name: Shape Self
entries: As an action, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob. While you have a humanlike shape, you can wear clothing and armor made for a Humanoid of your size.

As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. As part of the same bonus action, you can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object. The pseudopod contains no sensory organs and can't attack, activate magic items, or lift more than 10 pounds.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: As long as you don't get killed, you are likely to live very long as you can't die of old age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Poppets are typically Lawful Neutral, carrying out the orders of their masters unerringly.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most sentient poppets are between 2 to 3 feet tall. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Construct.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Harmless Appearance
entries: While motionless, if you match your surroundings, you are indistinguishable from a regular doll. If your form makes no sense or stands out in its surroundings, you must make a {@skill Stealth|phb} check contested by any onlookers' {@skill Perception|phb} checks, with advantage or disadvantage given out based on how far-fetched your appearance is given the surroundings. If the onlooker(s) are actively looking for you or are attempting to figure out whether or not an object is you, this check may become {@skill Investigation|phb} rather than {@skill Perception|phb}.

entries.name: Living Doll
entries: The spark of life that differentiates you from nonsentient Poppets allows you to talk. However, still, as a construct:

items: You are immune to Poison damage
You are immune to being Asleep, Diseased, {@condition Exhaustion|thicc|Exhausted}, {@condition Petrified|phb}, and {@condition Poisoned|phb}.
You don't have to and cannot eat or drink, meaning you can't gain the benefits of potions or food.
You can not breathe, and are immune to breathing-related checks such as smelling or poison gas.
Any missing limbs can be reattached via the {@spell Mending|cooms} or {@spell Repair|cooms} spells following the rules and stipulations of the given spells.
You may not expend hit dice to heal on a short rest.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious|phb}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: One of a Kind
entries: When you die, the magic used in your creation is released into the world, just as it would with any other broken magic item. If your body is somehow reanimated, you will not be the same person, acting as a new character, only retaining the things that are inherent to your old body such as any modifications you made to it.

entries.name: Loose Ties
entries: You have disadvantage on Death Saves, as the potent spirit that powers you is eager to be freed of its curse and escape to their afterlife once you die.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and one other language of its master.

entries.name: Age
entries: Quaggoths reach adulthood at age 8 and live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Quaggoths tended to live in nomadic hunting societies, if not enslaved by another denizen of the Underdark. They tended towards Chaotic alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most Quaggoths are between 6 and 7 feet tall, weighing around 250 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Poison Immunity
entries: You're immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Long-Limbed
entries: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Undercommon|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Satyrs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Satyrs delight in living a life free of the mantle of law. They gravitate toward being good, but some have devious streaks and enjoy causing dismay.

entries.name: Size
entries: Satyrs range from just under 5 feet to about 6 feet in height, with generally slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Ram
entries: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Mirthful Leaps
entries: Whenever you make a long or high jump, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

entries.name: Reveler
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Performance|phb} and {@skill Persuasion|phb} skills, and you have proficiency with one {@item musical instrument|OWL} of your choice.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Sylvan|phb}.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

entries.name: Age
entries: Shadar-blaidd, due to their werewolf origins, mature at the same rate as a human, but due to their corrupted nature, are considered lucky to live half as long.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Shadar-blaidd are natural hunters, preferring to stick together hunting like wolves, and tend towards Chaotic Evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Shadar-blaidd normally tower over humans, but some have been known to be around human height, being between 5 to 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Fearsmell
entries: Your ability to smell is so refined that you can literally smell the fear given off nearby creatures. Among the creatures affected by your bloodsense, you are able to determine which among them has the lowest HP, as you can smell who is most afraid. Any creatures immune to being {@condition frightened|phb} are likewise exempt from this ability. This ability is also disrupted if any of those creatures are {@condition frightened|phb}, as you always smell them as being the most afraid. If multiple creatures within your bloodsense are {@condition frightened|phb}, the creature with the lowest HP is who you can smell as being the most afraid.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Shadowshape
entries: As an action, you can make use of your corrupted, unstable nature bestowed onto your kind by Shadowfell by merging your form with your shadow. When you take the action or as an action thereafter on any turn while you are in this form, you can change your shape to be of a creature one size larger or smaller than your true form, allowing you to deceive creatures from your true nature. If you change your size using this feature, you still count as a Medium creature when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. Staying in this new form requires concentration, as if you were casting a spell. While in this form, you gain the following traits:

items: You turn completely black and cast no shadow.
Anything nonliving that is being worn or carried by you is merged with your form.

You have advantage on {@skill Stealth|phb} and {@skill Deception|phb} checks made to hide or pretend to be another creature while in total darkness to any creature beyond 30 feet of yourself. You have disadvantage on these checks while in bright light.
Equipment merged with your form becomes unusable to you while in this form, though you still retain the AC granted to you by your worn armor, shields not included.
You may use your natural weapons to attack while in this form.
You may cast spells in this form so long as they require no M component.

You are able to use 5 feet of movement to press yourself against a solid surface such as a wall or floor in such a way that you appear flat, allowing you to slip through cracks in walls as thin as a sheet of paper but no shorter than 2.5 feet tall in at least 1 dimension. You may use 5 feet of movement to emerge from this state. While pressed against a floor, you are Prone. While in this state, you may attack creatures within 5 feet of the surface by emerging parts of your body from the surface (without expending movement). Unless directly pressed against or standing on the surface you are flattened on, enemies do not halt your movement.

As a bonus action, you can extrude a tendril that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. As part of the same bonus action, you can use this tendril to manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, or pick up or set down a Tiny object. The tendril contains no sensory organs and can't attack, activate magic items, or lift more than 10 pounds.

entries.name: Lycanthropic Resistance
entries: You are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered. Additionally, you cannot contract another form of Lycanthropy.

entries.name: Radiant Vulnerability
entries: You are vulnerable to radiant damage.

entries.name: Unstable Form
entries: You have disadvantage on Constitution and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Shifters are quick to mature both physically and emotionally, reaching young adulthood at age 10. They rarely live to be more than 70 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Shifters tend toward neutrality, being more focused on survival than concepts of good and evil. A love of personal freedom can drive shifters toward chaotic alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Shifting
entries: As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You also gain additional benefits that depend on your shifter subrace, described below.
Once you shift, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Due to their extremely fast metabolism Skaven can live naturally to the ages of 20 to 30. However, due to their tendency to stab and kill co-workers, they normally live to the age of 4 if they're lucky, where they are finally considered an adult. This short lifespan often causes the more evil or intelligent to waste their later years trying to extend it via dark pacts or magic.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Skaven, due to their backstabbing nature, will most often turn out Chaotic Evil, as other Skaven take advantage of traits like sympathy and empathy in Skaven culture.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most Skaven are between 4 to 6 feet tall.Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Conniving
entries: You are proficient in two of the following skills: {@skill Deception|phb}, {@skill Insight|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb}, and {@skill Stealth|phb}.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Filthy Plaguebearer
entries: Growing up and spawning in filth has its advantages. You are resistant to poison, have advantage against poison saving throws, and are immune to the effects of diseases. However, you can still spread them.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand, read and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Undercommon|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tabaxi have lifespans equivalent to humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tabaxi are taller on average than humans and relatively slender. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Feline Agility
entries: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Cat's Talents
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} and {@skill Stealth|phb} skills.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: While you aren't wearing armor, your carapace gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

As an action, you can change the color of your carapace to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|phb}) checks made to {@action hide|phb} in those surroundings.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Secondary Arms
entries: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property.

entries.name: Sleepless
entries: You do not require sleep and can remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest.

entries.name: Thri-kreen Telepathy
entries: Without the assistance of magic, you can't speak the non-thri-kreen languages you know. Instead you use telepathy to convey your thoughts. You have the magical ability to transmit your thoughts mentally to willing creatures within 120 feet of yourself. A contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to understand your thoughts, but it must be able to understand at least one language. Your telepathic link to a creature is broken if you and the creature move more than 120 feet apart, if either of you is {@condition incapacitated|phb}, or if either of you mentally breaks the contact (no action required).

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Chameleon Carapace
entries: While you aren't wearing armor, your carapace gives you a base Armor Class of 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

As an action, you can change the color of your carapace to match the color and texture of your surroundings, giving you advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|phb}) checks made to hide in those surroundings.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: While you aren't wearing heavy or medium armor, your long jump is up to 30 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sleepless
entries: You do not require sleep, are incapable of doing so, and can remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest.

entries.name: Secondary Arms
entries: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property. You may also use your primary and secondary arms to make an unarmed attack. When you do so, you roll twice the die you normally do, and the damage type is changed to slashing. For example, a regular thri-kreen may deal {@dice 2d2} slashing damage with their unarmed strike, but a monk may deal {@dice 2d4} or higher as their die increases.

entries.name: Insect Mouth
entries: Without the assistance of magic, you can't speak the non-thri-kreen languages you know. However, your mouth enables you to make a special unarmed attack in which you use your poisonous bite. A creature hit by your bite takes {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or become {@condition Poisoned|phb} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on themselves as a success. At level 5, your bite becomes so toxic that enemies {@condition Poisoned|phb} in this way are also {@condition Paralyzed|phb}.

entries.name: Thri-kreen Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item Gythka|OWL} and the {@item Chatkcha|OWL}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Your tiefling might not look like other tieflings. Rather than having the physical characteristics described in the Player's Handbook, choose {@dice 1d4+1} of the following features: small horns; fangs or sharp teeth; a forked tongue; catlike eyes; six fingers on each hand; goatlike legs; cloven hoofs; a forked tail; leathery or scaly skin; red or dark blue skin; cast no shadow or reflection; exude a smell of brimstone. Additionally, due to your specific planetouched nature, your skin is rough and you have longer limbs than normal.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tieflings are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Acheronic Resistance
entries: Your body is covered in a rough hide and your bones are almost as strong as iron. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Long-limbed
entries: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Black Cloud
entries: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an attack unique to your kind. You release a choking, toxic black cloud.

Creatures within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw versus your Constitution DC or take a number of d6 poison damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) and become {@condition Poisoned|phb} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, is not {@condition poisoned|phb}, and is immune to the effects of all Black Clouds for the next 24 hours. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on themselves as a success.
You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fiend.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Infernal|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Your tiefling might not look like other tieflings. Rather than having the physical characteristics described in the Player's Handbook, choose {@dice 1d4+1} of the following features: small horns; fangs or sharp teeth; a forked tongue; catlike eyes; six fingers on each hand; goatlike legs; cloven hoofs; a forked tail; leathery or scaly skin; red or dark blue skin; cast no shadow or reflection; exude a smell of brimstone. Additionally, due to your specific planetouched nature, your skin is rough and you have longer limbs than normal.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tieflings are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Hellish Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against fire and poison damage.

entries.name: Infernal Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell thaumaturgy|cooms} cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell hellish rebuke|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fiend.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Infernal|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Your tiefling might not look like other tieflings. Rather than having the physical characteristics described in the Player's Handbook, choose {@dice 1d4+1} of the following features: small horns; fangs or sharp teeth; a forked tongue; catlike eyes; six fingers on each hand; goatlike legs; cloven hoofs; a forked tail; leathery or scaly skin; red or dark blue skin; cast no shadow or reflection; exude a smell of brimstone. Additionally, due to your specific planetouched nature, your skin is rough and you have longer limbs than normal.

entries.name: Size

entries.name: Darkvision
