entries.name: Abyssal Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also gain resistance to cold, fire, or lightning damage.

entries.name: Variant Head
entries: You have a natural weapon on your head that you may use against your enemies. Choose one of the following options:

items: {@b Beak.} Your beak is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

{@b Bite.} Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

{@b Horns.} Your horns are a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Variant Body
entries: You have a natural weapon on your body that you may use against your enemies. Choose one of the following options:

items: {@b Claws.} Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

{@b Fists.} Your fists are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

{@b Hooves.} Your hooves are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with your offhoof if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Variant Feature
entries: Your form, though chaotic, is also gifted with an odd specialty. Choose two of the following options:

items: {@b Aggressive.} As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

{@b Bloodsense.} If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. Constructs, Elementals, Oozes, Plants, and Undead are immune to the effects of this sense.
{@b Powerful Build.} You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

{@b Rampage.} When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you may use a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make an attack with the natural weapon granted to you by your Variant Head feature.
{@b Shadow Stealth.} While in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action as a bonus action.
{@b Siege Monster.} You deal double damage to objects and structures.
{@b Spider Climb.} You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

{@b Stench.} Any creature that can smell other than a demon that starts its turn within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw versus your Constitution DC (8 + Proficiency Bonus + Constitution modifier) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to your stench for 1 hour.

entries.name: Violent Savagery

entries.name: Mind-Breaking Howl
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a keening howl.

When you use your Mind-Breaking Howl, each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Wisdom saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the creature takes a number of d6 psychic damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). Additionally, the creature is {@condition Frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and is immune to the effects of all Mind-Breaking Howls for the next 24 hours.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Necrotic Consumption
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the unholy energy within yourself, causing a depressing darkness to emanate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to hollow you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you eminate heavily-obscuring darkness in a 10-foot radius and lightly-obscuring shadows for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take necrotic damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra necrotic damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries: You know the {@spell thaumaturgy|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell searing smite|cooms} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell branding smite|cooms} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fiend.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Infernal|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young tortles crawl for a few weeks after birth before learning to walk on two legs. They reach adulthood by the age of 15 and live an average of 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Tortles tend to lead orderly, ritualistic lives. They develop customs and routines, becoming more set in their ways as they age. Most are lawful good. A few can be selfish and greedy, tending more toward evil, but it's unusual for a tortle to shuck off order in favor of chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tortle adults stand 5 to 6 feet tall and average 450 pounds. Their shells account for roughly one-third of their weight. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. Tortles aren't natural swimmers, but they can remain underwater for some time before needing to come up for air.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

entries.name: Shell Defense
entries: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are {@condition prone}, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

entries.name: Survival Instinct
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival|phb} skill. Tortles have finely honed survival instincts.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language primordial|phb|Aquan} and {@language Common|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tritons reach maturity around age 15 and can live up to 200 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Tritons tend toward neutrality. Their culture encourages them to be mindful of life's currents, knowing when to harness fate's tides and when to flow along with them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tritons are slightly shorter than humans, averaging about 5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Control Air and Water
entries: A child of the sea, you can call on the magic of elemental air and water. You can cast {@spell fog cloud|phb} with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell gust of wind|phb} with it, and starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell wall of water|COOMS} with it. Once you cast a spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Emissary of the Sea
entries: Aquatic beasts have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

entries.name: Guardians of the Depths
entries: Adapted to even the most extreme ocean depths, you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Primordial|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Due to their tribal lifestyle, they are considered adults at the age of 15 and usually live to a maximum of 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Troglodytes constantly war with nearby settlements, convinced the world was full of creatures seeking to kill them, a self-fulfilling prophecy that leads them towards Chaotic Evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Fearsmell
entries: Your ability to smell is so refined that you can literally smell the fear given off nearby creatures. Among the creatures affected by your bloodsense, you are able to determine which among them has the lowest HP, as you can smell who is most afraid. Any creatures immune to being {@condition frightened|phb} are likewise exempt from this ability. This ability is also disrupted if any of those creatures are {@condition frightened|phb}, as you always smell them as being the most afraid. If multiple creatures within your bloodsense are {@condition frightened|phb}, the creature with the lowest HP is who you can smell as being the most afraid.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that can smell other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw versus your Constitution DC (8 + Proficiency Bonus + Constitution modifier) or be {@condition poisoned|phb} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

entries.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|phb}) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Troglodyte|mm}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ursalin matured at the same rate as humans, with a similar lifespan.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ursalin are living in constant conflict between their Owlin half and their Ursarth half, leading them to a frustrated Neutral, or even Evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ursalin are towering, imposing, and wide figures. Ursalin were between 7 to 8 feet tall, and weighed anywhere from 350 to 600 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Beak
entries: Your beak is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Hibernation
entries: During winter, you require twice as much sleep than a normal humanoid, requiring 12 hours of sleep every day to gain the benefits of a long rest and avoid sleep deprivation. Additionally, the DC for {@condition exhaustion|THICC} from sleep deprivation increases from 15 to 21 for you. You are likewise vulnerable to sleeping magic during winter, as your hit points only count for half of what they normally would for spells like {@spell Sleep|phb}.

entries.name: Violet Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being {@condition Frenzied|THICC}.

items: {@b Natural Predators.} You have proficiency in two of the following skills: {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

{@b Superior Darkvision.} You can see in dim light within 120 feet of yourself as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.
{@b Cold Resistance} You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Sylvan|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ursarth matured at the same rate as humans, with a similar lifespan.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Before their corruption at the hands of an especially powerful archfey over several millennia ago, werebears were a symbol of protection for the natural world. Now, no trace of their previous ancestry remains, including their lycanthropic curse and good nature. Instead, ursarth only guard and protect what they believe to be their hunting ground, eliminating anything stronger than them in their territory while still acting as stewards to the land. Ursarth were solitary by nature and generally untrusting of others. They typically only congregate during mating season, when their love for mead leads to havoc upon local communities. They tend towards Chaotic alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Black ursarth are well-built or chubby figures. Black ursarth were between 5 to 7 feet tall, and weighed anywhere from 250 to 450 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Natural Predators
entries: You have proficiency in two of the following skills: {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Intimidation|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, {@skill Perception|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Cold Resistance

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language Sylvan|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Verdan reach adulthood at around the age of 24, and it is thought that they might live to nearly 200 years old. However, because no verdan has died of old age since the race's initial creation, their upper age limits remain subject to speculation.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Verdan are generally good, although their absence of racial identity and shared history can sometimes see individual verdan become untethered from any moral or ethical framework.

entries.name: Size
entries: Verdan start out similar in size to the goblins they were created from, ranging from 3 to 4 feet in height. But at some point after reaching maturity, each verdan undergoes a sudden growth spurt of 2 feet or more. At 1st level, you are a Small creature. When you reach 5th level, you become a Medium creature.

entries.name: Black Blood Healing
entries: The black blood that is a sign of your people's connection to That-Which-Endures boosts your natural healing. When you roll a 1 or 2 on any Hit Die you spend at the end of a short rest, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathy, but it must be able to understand at least one language. This process of communication is slow and limited, allowing you to transmit and receive only simple ideas and straightforward concepts.

entries.name: Persuasive
entries: Your people's lack of history makes you trustworthy and humble. You have proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion|phb} skill.

entries.name: Telepathic Insight
entries: Your mind's connection to the world around you strengthens your will. You have advantage on all Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Language
entries: You speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Goblin|phb}, and one additional language of your choice. This language typically has some connection to one of the areas or cultures that has been part of your life.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You are immune to Poison damage
You are immune to being Asleep, Diseased, Exhausted, and Poisoned.
You don't have to and cannot eat or drink, meaning you can't gain the benefits of potions or food.
You can not breathe, and are immune to breathing-related checks such as smelling or poison gas.
Any missing limbs can be reattached via the Mending or Repair spells following the rules and stipulations of the given spells.
You may not expend hit dice to heal on a short rest.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious|phb}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor other than a shield, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, the armor incorporated into your body can't be removed against your will.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: One of a Kind
entries: When you die, the magic used in your creation is released into the world, just as it would with any other broken magic item. If your body is somehow reanimated, you will not be the same person, acting as a new character, only retaining the things that are inherent to your old body such as any modifications you made to it.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Construct.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Wendigos reach maturity around 12 years. They live long, solitary lives, between 100 and 150 years, something they attribute as the blessing of Baphomet for their carnivorous way of life.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Wendigos are a manifestation of the long winter, and the madness and hunger it can bring. It is said that these foul creatures were once Cervans, transformed by Baphomet after committing cannibalism during a time in which all other Gods seemed to have abandoned them. They now live constantly in the same hunger from that time ago, and bring the cold with them, leading them towards the Chaotic Evil alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most wendigo are between 6 and 7 feet tall, weighing anywhere from 140 lbs to 180 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Antlers
entries: You have a set of large, strong antlers that can be used to make devastating charge attacks to weaken your prey. Your antlers are a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Piercing Charge
entries: If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line towards an opponent, you can use a bonus action to make a special antlers attack as you charge them. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and the creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Strength DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or take an extra amount of d6 piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus, only taking half as much on a success. If the target of your charge is Large or smaller and they fail the saving throw, you can choose to either push them 10 feet away from you as if you had shoved them twice, or you can choose to knock them prone. Once you hit with this feature, regardless of if your target succeeds or fails, you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your bite is a natural weapon that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hungry Jaws
entries: In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Endless Hunger
entries: You can eat and drink as well as retain the benefits of 5 times more food and drink than an equivalent creature of your size, but must eat and drink 3 times more than the average person to not starve.
When under the effects of starvation, you are frenzied.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons that you are proficient with, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. You may also attack with the claws in your offhand if it is free to do so as a bonus action, though you do not add your Strength modifier to the damage roll if you hit with them.

entries.name: Dispairing Magic
entries: You know the {@spell frostbite|xge} cantrip. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell enemies abound|xge} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Horrific Appearence
entries: Due to your face resembling that of death, you have advantage on all {@skill Intimidation|phb} checks, but disadvantage on all {@skill Persuasion|phb} checks.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight|phb}) check opposed by your Charisma ({@skill Deception|phb}) check.

entries.name: Wendigo Resistances
entries: You have resistance to cold and necrotic damage.

entries.name: Pyrophobic
entries: You are vulnerable to fire damage. Any time you take fire damage, you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw whose DC is equal to the fire damage taken, or you become {@condition Frightened|phb} of the source of the fire until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Monstrosity.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Abyssal|phb}.

entries.name: Age
entries: Purebloods mature at the same rate as humans and have lifespans similar in length to theirs.

entries.name: Size
entries: Purebloods match humans in average size and weight. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell poison spray|phb} cantrip. You can cast {@spell animal friendship|phb} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast {@spell suggestion|phb} with this trait. Once you cast it, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Poison Immunity
entries: You are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Abyssal|phb}, and {@language Draconic|phb}.

entries.name: Necrotic Shroud
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back. The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc} 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become {@condition frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra necrotic damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Radiant Soul
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed of 30 feet, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Radiant Consumption
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take radiant damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tinker
entries: You gain proficiency in {@item Tinker's Tools|OWL}.

entries.name: Self-Repairing Machine
entries: You know the {@spell mending|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell repair|cooms} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell lesser restoration|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You may substitute {@item Tinker's Tools|OWL} as the material component for any of these spells when cast with a range of self. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Built for Success
entries: You can add your Constitution modifier to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: Grove cervans, which are almost always female, stand between 5 and 6 feet tall, and have light builds, weighing between 130 and 180 pounds. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Peaceful
entries: Cervans thrive together, and like to spend their time learning useful skills for life in their woodland villages. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Medicine|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Prosperous Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you learn the {@spell purify food and drink|phb} spell and can cast it as a ritual. Additionally, you are able to cast it without spending a spell slot once per short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell lesser restoration|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Nimble Step
entries: Opportunity attacks made against you are rolled with disadvantage.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: Pronghorn cervans, which are almost always male, are taller and tend toward heavier, more muscular builds, standing around 7 feet tall, and sometimes weighing over 200 pounds. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Peaceful
entries: Cervans thrive together, and like to spend their time learning useful skills for life in their woodland villages. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Providing Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you learn the {@spell detect poison and disease|phb} spell and can cast it as a ritual. Additionally, you are able to cast it without spending a spell slot once per short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell locate animals or plants|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Antlers
entries: You have a set of large, strong antlers that can be used to make devastating charge attacks as a last resort for those that wish to hurt you or your kin. You are proficient with your antlers attack, which is a melee weapon attack that deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage plus your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Piercing Charge
entries: If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line towards an opponent, you can use a bonus action to make a special antlers attack as you charge them. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and the creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Strength DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or take an extra amount of {@dice d6} piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus, only taking half as much on a success. If the target of your charge is Large or smaller and they fail the saving throw, you can choose to either push them 10 feet away from you as if you had shoved them twice, or you can choose to knock them prone. Once you hit with this feature, regardless of if your target succeeds or fails, you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Chromatic Warding
entries: Starting at 5th level, as an action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Draconic|phb}. {@language Draconic|phb} is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|thicc} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your {@quickref proficiency bonus|phb}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 1d10} acid damage equal to 1 less than your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage.

items.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|thicc} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon.

entries.name: Psionic Mind
entries: You can send telepathic messages to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand these messages, but it must be able to understand at least one language to comprehend them.

entries.name: Gem Flight
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages

The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries: You have resistance to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Metallic Breath Weapon
entries: At 5th level, you gain a second breath weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Whenever you use this trait, choose one:
{@b Enervating Breath}. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated until the start of your next turn.
{@b Repulsion Breath}. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Duergar Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Undercommon.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Armor Training
entries: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

entries.name: Astral Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you remain conscious.

Whenever you finish this trance, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and with one weapon or tool of your choice, selected from the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory and the experiences of entities on the Astral Plane, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

entries.name: Astral Fire
entries: You know one of the following cantrips of your choice: {@spell dancing lights|cooms}, {@spell light|phb}, or {@spell sacred flame|phb}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Starlight Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}

entries.name: Drow Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|cooms} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Drow Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with {@item rapier|OWL|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|OWL|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|OWL|hand crossbows}.

subrace.name: Eladrin

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}
{@i Choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a long rest, you can change your season. See the "Info" tab for more information.}

entries.name: Fey Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier:

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed|phb} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spring
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fey.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item katana|OWL}, {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item tanto|OWL}, {@item wakizashi|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Incisive Sense
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|phb}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight|phb}) checks.

entries.name: Blessing of the Moon Weaver
entries: You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}

entries.name: Sea Elf Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item spear|OWL}, {@item trident|OWL}, {@item light crossbow|OWL}, and {@item net|OWL}.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan}.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item katana|OWL}, {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item tanto|OWL}, {@item wakizashi|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Unending Breath
entries: You naturally produce the air that you breathe, and can share this air by locking lips with a creature. This also means that you can hold their breath indefinitely.

entries.name: Lightning Resistance
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Mingle with the Wind
entries: You know the {@spell gust|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell feather fall|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell gust of wind|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Auran}.

entries.name: Earth Walk
entries: You can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement.

entries.name: Stone Resistance
entries: You learn the {@spell blade ward|phb} cantrip and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest, as you cause your rough skin to momentarily turn to stone. On top of this, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition petrified}.

entries.name: Merge with Stone
entries: You know the {@spell mold earth|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell earth tremor|xge} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell pass without trace|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Terran}.

entries.name: Flaming Hair
entries: Fire genasi sport a head of hair that is either made of fire or constantly aflame. They shed bright light out to 10 feet and dim light an additional 10 feet, and can choose to dim their hair at will to half the light they produce.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Reach to the Blaze
entries: You know the {@spell control flames|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell burning hands|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell flame blade|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Ignan}.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Call to the Wave
entries: You know the {@spell shape water|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell create or destroy water|cooms} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell misty step|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Aquan}.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Githyanki tend toward lawful evil. They are aggressive and arrogant, and they remain the faithful servants of their lich-queen, Vlaakith. Renegade githyanki tend toward chaos.

entries.name: Decadent Mastery
entries: You learn one language of your choice, and you are proficient with one skill or {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice. In the timeless city of Tu'narath, githyanki have bountiful time to master odd bits of knowledge.

entries.name: Martial Prodigy
entries: You are proficient with light and medium armor and with {@item shortsword|OWL|shortswords}, {@item longsword|OWL|longswords}, and {@item greatsword|OWL|greatswords}.

entries.name: Githyanki Psionics
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand|phb} cantrip, and the hand is {@condition invisible|phb} when you cast the cantrip with this trait.

When you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell jump|phb} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell misty step|phb} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Githzerai tend toward lawful neutral. Their rigorous training in psychic abilities requires an implacable mental discipline.

entries.name: Mental Discipline
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition charmed|phb} and {@condition frightened|phb} conditions. Under the tutelage of monastic masters, githzerai learn to govern their own minds.

entries.name: Githzerai Psionics
entries: You know the {@spell mage hand|phb} cantrip, and the hand is {@condition invisible|phb} when you cast the cantrip with this trait.

When you reach 3rd level, you can cast {@spell shield|cooms} once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts|phb} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast them with this trait, they don't require components.

entries.name: Age
entries: Deep gnomes are short-lived for gnomes. They mature at the same rate humans do and are considered full-grown adults by 25. They live 200 to 250 years, although hard toil and the dangers of the Underdark often claim them before their time.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Svirfneblin believe that survival depends on avoiding entanglements with other creatures and not making enemies, so they favor neutral alignments. They rarely wish others ill, and they are unlikely to take risks on behalf of others.

entries.name: Size
entries: A typical svirfneblin stands about 3 to 3.5 feet tall and weighs 80 to 120 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|phb}) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb}, {@language Gnomish|phb}, and {@language Undercommon|phb}. The svirfneblin dialect is more guttural than surface Gnomish, and most svirfneblin know only a little bit of Common, but those who deal with outsiders (and that includes you as an adventurer) pick up enough Common to get by in other lands.

entries.name: Natural Illusionist
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Speak with Small Beasts
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

entries.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History|phb}) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

entries.name: Tinker
entries: You have proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|OWL}). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.
When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Clockwork Toy
entries: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

entries.name: Fire Starter
entries: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

entries.name: Music Box
entries: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Duergar Magic.} When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

{@b Dwarven Toughness.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Fey Ancestry.} You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Drow Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with {@item rapier|owl|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|owl|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|owl|hand crossbows}.

{@b Drow Magic.} You know the {@spell dancing lights|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|cooms} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.
