entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Dwarven Armor Training.} You have proficiency with light and medium armor.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.
{@b Dwarven Toughness.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Fey Ancestry.} You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.

{@b Elf Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item katana|OWL}, {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item tanto|OWL}, {@item wakizashi|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.
{@b Sea Elf Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.
{@b Child of the Sea.} You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.
{@b Fleet of Foot.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@b Mask of the Wild.} You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
{@b Cantrip.} You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.
{@b Extra Language.} You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Gnomish, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Gnome Cunning.} You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.

{@b Superior Darkvision.} Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
{@b Stone Camouflage.} You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.
{@b Natural Illusionist.} You know the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

{@b Speak with Small Beasts.} Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

{@b Artificer's Lore.} Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) or Intelligence (Arcana) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

{@b Tinker.} You have proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|phb|Tinker's Tools}). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

entries.name: When you create a device, choose one of the following options:
entries: {@b Clockwork Toy.} This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
{@b Fire Starter.} The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
{@b Music Box.} When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Halfling, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Brave.} You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened|phb}.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Lucky.} When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
{@b Halfling Nimbleness.} You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

{@b Silent Speech.} You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.
{@b Naturally Stealthy.} You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

{@b Child of the Wood.} You know the {@spell druidcraft|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell entangle|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell spike growth|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Timberwalk.} Ability checks made to track you have disadvantage, and you can move across difficult terrain made of nonmagical plants and undergrowth without expending extra movement.
{@b Stout Resilience.} You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Draconic Resilience.
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

{@b Astral Fire.} You know one of the following cantrips of your choice: {@spell dancing lights|cooms}, {@spell light|phb}, or {@spell sacred flame|phb}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

{@b Starlight Step.} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Drow Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with {@item rapier|OWL|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|OWL|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|OWL|hand crossbows}.

{@b Drow Magic.} You know the {@spell dancing lights|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|cooms} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Fey Step.} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

{@i Regardless of whether or not you choose this feature, you must choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. If you choose this feature, when you finish a long rest, you can change your season.}
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed|phb} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spring
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fey.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

{@b Elf Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item katana|OWL}, {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item tanto|OWL}, {@item wakizashi|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.
{@b Cantrip.} You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.
{@b Extra Language.} You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Incisive Sense.} You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|phb}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight|phb}) checks.

{@b Blessing of the Moon Weaver.} You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Extra Language.} You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan}
{@b Sea Elf Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item spear|OWL}, {@item trident|OWL}, {@item light crossbow|OWL}, and {@item net|OWL}.
{@b Child of the Sea.} You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.
{@b Friend of the Sea.} Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Necrotic Resistance.} You have resistance to necrotic damage.

{@b Blessing of the Raven Queen.} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

{@b Elf Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item katana|OWL}, {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item tanto|OWL}, {@item wakizashi|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.
{@b Fleet of Foot.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@b Mask of the Wild.} You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Silent Speech
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Child of the Wood
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell entangle|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell spike growth|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Timberwalk
entries: Ability checks made to track you have disadvantage, and you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain|phb|3} made of nonmagical plants and undergrowth without expending extra movement.

entries.name: Stout Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Hunkered Curl
entries: You can use your action to curl up, exposing attackers to a wall of your toughened quills. Until you uncurl, your natural armor changes to an AC of 16 + your Constitution modifier, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While curled up, you are prone, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to uncurl.

Additionally, while you are curled up, if you are either unarmored or wearing spiked leather, spiked armor, or spike mail, your spines jut out. Any creature who misses a melee attack against you while within 5 feet of you, hits you with an unarmed attack, or touches you takes a number of {@dice d4} piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus. This ability does not stack with the damage done by your natural armor, replacing it instead.

entries.name: Natural Burrowers
entries: You have a burrowing speed of 15 feet. You are capable of burrowing through soil, but are unable to dig through anything more substantial with just your clawed hands.

entries.name: Rolling Curl
entries: You can use your bonus action to curl up, using your toughened quills to become a spinning ball of spikes. Until you uncurl, you move around by rolling, you can't take reactions, and the only actions you can take are the dash action, a special slamming attack action, and a bonus action to uncurl. While you are curled up, you can make a special unarmed attack by slamming your rolling body into an enemy. Make a melee weapon attack against an enemy within 5 feet of yourself. If you are either unarmored or wearing spiked leather, spiked armor, or spike mail, this attack does {@dice 2d4} + your Strength modifier piercing damage. Otherwise, this attack does {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage. If you charge at your target by rolling at least 20 feet in a straight line towards them immediately before attacking them with a slam attack, you may roll twice the damage die that you normally would for that slam.

Additionally, while you are curled up, if you are either unarmored or wearing spiked leather, spiked armor, or spike mail, your spines jut out. Any creature who misses a melee attack against you while within 5 feet of you, hits you with an unarmed attack, or touches you takes a number of {@dice d4} piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus. This ability does not stack with the damage done by your natural armor, replacing it instead.

entries.name: Spinning Blur
entries: Your walking speed increases to 30 feet.

entries.name: Human Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in three skills or tools of your choice.

entries.name: Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Feat
entries: You gain one {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice.

entries.name: Drought Resistance
entries: Due to your natural proclivity towards areas with little to no water, you can go up to a month without water. You also take half damage from spells that drain moisture like {@spell Blight|COOMS}.

entries.name: Spiny
entries: Spines cover your body. Your unarmed attack deals piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. On top of this, anybody who attacks you with an unarmed strike takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Freakish Appearance
entries: Flytrap Leshies normally hunt in pacts and scare their prey into accidentally scurrying into a trap set by them. You have proficiency in {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Stealth}.

entries.name: Acidic Bite
entries: Your mouth is lined with digestive acids, allowing you to eat even if your teeth aren't too sharp. Your unarmed attack deals acid damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Reclusive
entries: Because of the value your body naturally provides as a source of food and curative magics, most Fruit Leshies are recluses, and tend to live in small, hidden communities out of fear of exploitation by outsiders. You gain proficiency in {@skill Medicine} and {@skill Stealth}.

entries.name: Nourishing
entries: Your body naturally bears nutritious and flavorful fruit. You can cast {@spell Goodberry|phb} once per long rest innately, using Constitution as your spellcasting ability modifier. Additionally, any creature that eats a majority of your corpse within a tenday of your death absorbs your natural healing and nourishing magic, and gains the following benefits:

items: They regain {@dice 5d8} hit points.
They lose all tiers of exhaustion currently affecting them.
One disease or lingering injury affecting the target is immediately cured.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sporecasting
entries: You know the {@spell Poison Spray|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Toxic Mist|COOMS} spell once with this trait; you gain the ability to cast it again when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you regain your ability to cast {@spell Toxic Mist|COOMS} on a short or long rest. Constitution is the spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Hard Rind
entries: Your gourd, though expressive and articulable to you, is still incredibly hard to others. Whenever you are hit with a critical strike, you may reduce the damage you take by a number of {@dice d4} equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Hollow Head
entries: You have a large, hollow gourd for a skull that you use to store things in. You can store up to 10 lbs worth of items within your head. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of the Use an Object or Attack action.

entries.name: Favorable Winds
entries: When you dash, you are carried away by winds, and can move an additional amount of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Graceful Falls
entries: Your body is made mostly from natural foliage, and like a leaf tumbling from a tree, you land from falls with particular grace. You have proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} skill and the maximum damage you can take from any fall is {@dice 1d6}, as you reach your terminal velocity at 10 feet of falling.

entries.name: Natural Beauty
entries: Your grace and elegance flows in every move you do. You have proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} and {@skill Performance}.

entries.name: Water Walking
entries: You can walk on the surface of still water, and it counts as difficult terrain for you. Flowing water requires an {@skill Acrobatics} check to balance on it with a DC equal to its DC to swim with an {@skill Athletics} check.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your body is covered in tough bark and littered with needles. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
On top of this, anybody who attacks you with an unarmed strike takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Sticky Sap
entries: You have a sticky sap that excretes from your body, making climbing, grappling, and holding onto your gear easier. You have a bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks and Strength saving throws equal to your Constitution modifier, minimum of 0. This bonus does not apply while you are underwater or airborne.

entries.name: Hearty Roots
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Sure Footing
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Athletics} and, while you are not airborne, swimming, or mounting a creature, you have advantage on Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Tangled Form
entries: You have advantage on all grapple checks.

entries.name: Underwater Habitat
entries: You are used to life in the water, and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. You can also breathe underwater.

entries.name: Sun Sense
entries: Sunflower Leshies have an innate obsession with the sun that affords them many benefits. You always know what direction is north and you always know what time it is, as you can sense the sun's location in the sky even without seeing it.

entries.name: Seed Spray
entries: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an attack unique to your kind. You launch a deluge of seeds from your head in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw versus your Constitution DC or take a number of {@dice d6} bludgeoning damage equal to your proficiency bonus, with half as much on a successful save. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Lashing Vines
entries: You know the {@spell Thorn Whip|phb} cantrip and can cast it innately using Dexterity as your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Creeping Climbers
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and climbing for you does not require hands.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Duergar Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Invisibility} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Natural Athlete.} You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.
{@b Mountain Born.} You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Stone's Endurance.} You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Mountain Born.} You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Stone's Endurance.} You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Natural Athlete.} You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Stone's Endurance.} You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
{@b Dwarven Armor Training.} You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Ashen One
entries: Your body has cracks in it that appear to be burning underneath, like a log on a dying fireplace. The instant you die, you can choose to instantly emerge from ashes left at the last place that you took a short or long rest (whichever is more recent). Your body reforms completely healed of any lingering injuries your previous body had, any and all missing limbs are restored, but you retain your previous age and any curses upon you. Once you reform in this way, your old body immediately collapses to ash, leaving behind all of your belongings and making it unable to be revived. Your new body instead looks cracked and hollow, giving you a -5 penalty to your Charisma ability score, halving your maximum hit points, and disabling both your resistance to fire as well as the innate spellcasting gained from your Champion of Ash feature.

You are not able to reform in this way again until you collect the embers of your last dead body and burn them in a brass brazier with ruby dust worth at least 1,300 gp over the course of a short rest. After the short rest, your body returns to as it was, regaining your previous appearance, fire resistance, innate spellcasting, Charisma score and maximum hit points, alongside healing to your new maximum hit points.

Your embers will appear as a congealed clump of ash and dying fire, vaguely resembling a heart, that call out to you. You can detect their presence innately as if you were under the effect of a {@spell Detect Magic|phb} spell. The embers appear to be of the school Evocation. Should they be destroyed, the ritual is impossible, and the only ways to undo the penalties given by this feature is to be affected by the spells {@spell Reincarnate|cooms}, {@spell True Resurrection|phb}, or {@spell Wish|phb}.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Champion of Ash
entries: You know the {@spell create bonfire|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell hellish rebuke|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell flaming sphere|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Ignan}.

entries.name: Master of Sleep
entries: You have perfected the art of the nap. You can take more than one long rest within 24 hours, and can go to sleep whenever you wish. This also means that magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Dust Resistance
entries: You learn the {@spell blade ward|phb} cantrip and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest, as you cause your skin to turn to sand and reform next round.

entries.name: Sink into the Sand
entries: You know the {@spell magic stone|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell dust devil|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language primordial|phb|Auran}, and {@language primordial|phb|Terran}.

entries.name: Buoyant
entries: You constantly freeze any water that touches you, up to half an inch thick from your skin. While not wearing heavy armor, you are under the effects of the {@spell Water Walk|phb} spell. You may focus on suppressing this feature as an action, which you can do for as long as you maintain concentration as if you were concentrating on a spell.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Deposit into the Frozen
entries: You know the {@spell frostbite|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell armor of agathys|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|xge} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan} and {@language primordial|phb|Auran}.

entries.name: Lightning Fast
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet. Additionally, you are able to generate static electricity from your fingertips at will, allowing you to lightly shock creatures at your leisure (not enough to deal damage). As a bonus action, by pinching your thumb and index fingers close together but not letting them touch, you are able to create a spark that carries enough energy to ignite an object as if you were using a tinderbox.

entries.name: Lightning Resistance
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: You know the {@spell shocking grasp|phb} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell witch bolt|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell shock pulse|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Auran}.

entries.name: Feed the Forge
entries: Your body is magmatic like a volcano, and repurposes metal you feed it to sustain itself. Instead of eating like a normal genasi, you can choose to eat 1 lb of fuel and 1 lb of metal in order to sustain yourself for the day. Fuel could be any flammable substance such as cloth, wood, coal, charcoal, or oil. Eating sharp objects is not without consequence. Before they are melted, they still cut your form on the way down. Whenever you eat a sharp weapon, you must take damage equal to a roll of its damage die as it slides into your form. Small pointed objects like nails or caltrops deal {@dice 1d2-1} damage as they enter your form. If a projectile such as an arrow or dagger is shot or thrown into you and does not go through you, you are able to eat it without taking further damage.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Melt into the Magma
entries: You know the {@spell green-flame blade|tce} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell searing smite|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell heat metal|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language primordial|phb|Ignan} and {@language primordial|phb|Terran}.

entries.name: Pretty Colors
entries: While any part of your body is under the effects of magical light, your body shines a dazzling display of color. You shine bright multicolored light out to 30 feet, and dim multicolored light out to an additional 30 feet. The bright portion of this light makes any creature with Sunlight Sensitivity suffer its effects as though it were Sunlight, despite not being Sunlight. Creatures with Sun Sickness, Sunlight Hypersensitivity, and the like take no damage from the light. Any time you take radiant damage, you shine in a similar fashion for 1 minute.

entries.name: Crystal Resistance
entries: You learn the {@spell blade ward|phb} cantrip and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest, as you cause your beautiful body to momentarily harden and crystallize.

entries.name: Shine like a Diamond
entries: You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell color spray|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell mirror image|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, and {@language primordial|phb|Terran}.

entries.name: Slippery and Sticky
entries: You have advantage on all checks related to tumbling and grappling, including improving and impairing stance.

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Bubble in the Swamp
entries: You know the {@spell acid splash|phb} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell grease|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell melf's acid arrow|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan} and {@language primordial|phb|Terran}.

entries.name: Glowing Form
entries: Your body naturally glows a warm color. You shine bright light out to 30 feet, and dim light out to an additional 30 feet, and can choose to dim this at will to half the light. As a bonus action, you can change this light to only shine from your eyes, doubling its range but making it only shine in a cone similar to a bullseye lantern.

entries.name: Radiant Resistance
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Bask in the Brilliance
entries: You know the {@spell sacred flame|phb} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell guiding bolt|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell holy ascension|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Ignan}.

entries.name: Salty Soul
entries: Your body can dehydrate without negative consequence. You do not suffer the effects of dehydration beyond a dry appearance, such as cracked lips. Additionally, by touching any raw meat for 1 minute, you are able to dry it to last as if it were salted.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Salt the Wounds
entries: You know the {@spell bloodletting|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell inflict wounds|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell ray of enfeeblement|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb} and {@language primordial|phb|Aquan}.

entries.name: Black Lungs
entries: When you exhale, you breathe out smoke, regardless of what you breathe in, as your body produces it naturally. This smoke production leads to a natural resistance your body has towards toxins, giving you advantage on saving throws against being Poisoned. This also means that where you would naturally become Suffocated, you instead become Poisoned as the smoke in your form builds up from you not exhaling to expel the smoke and not inhaling anything to dilute it.

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You have resistance to posion damage.

entries.name: Choke on the Smoke
entries: You know the {@spell poison spray|phb} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell combustion|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell toxic mist|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language primordial|phb|Auran} and {@language primordial|phb|Ignan}.

entries.name: Keen Eyed, Hot Tempered
entries: You can see through smoke, fog, mist, and other atmospheric effects unusually well. Objects and creatures lightly obscured by such phenomena are instead not obscured to you. Additionally, when you are particularly furious, the sound of a kettle boiling can be heard as steam shoots out of your ears.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Mirage in the Mist
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell fog cloud|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell blur|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, {@language primordial|phb|Aquan} and {@language primordial|phb|Ignan}.

entries.name: Vacuous Hunger
entries: You can eat and drink as well as retain the benefits of 5 times more food and drink than an equivalent creature of your size, but must eat and drink 3 times more than the average person to not starve. No matter how much you eat, you always appear bone-thin.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Fade into the Void
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights|cooms} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell magnify gravity|cooms} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell levitate|phb} spell once with this trait without requiring a material component, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak {@language Common|phb}, and {@language primordial|phb|Auran}.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|phb} skill.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: Whenever you shift, you gain {@dice 1d6} additional temporary hit points. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Fierce
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|phb} skill.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: While shifted, you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike as a bonus action. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Graceful
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics|phb} skill.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: While shifted, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you can move up to 10 feet as a reaction when a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This reactive movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Natural Tracker
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival|phb} skill.

entries.name: Shifting Feature
entries: While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you, unless you're {@condition incapacitated|phb}.
